reviews.title: Great quiet location but needs some minor upgrades
reviews.text: floor and is self-service with croissants, breads, cheeses, juices and tea or coffee. Trams 5 and 2 run past the top of the street and these will take you into the centre or onto Central Station. We purchased a 72 hour pass which was 13.50 euros and we used it a lot. It is just a few minutes walk to the Reichs museum, the Van Gogh museum and the Concertgebouw. There are places to eat and drink a few minutes walk across the park on Franz Hals Street and round the corner on Van Baerle street. We enjoyed the Cafe Vertigo beneath the film museum in Vondel Park, Pompa Cafe on Willemparkweg and old-fashioned Cafe Welling behind the Concertgebouw (avoid if you dislike smoking!)

Last morning we had a breakfast at 6:30, becouse our bus shuttle was leaving for tairport at 7. Regular breakfast is from 7:30 till 10.

reviews.title: Hotel Aalders-a pleasant experience!
reviews.text: I suggest this hotel to everyone.
Our family of 4 stayed in a quadraple room with a balcony overlooking the front street. It was a big cosy room with clean attached shower & toilet. This is a smoke-free hotel with a lift.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a lovely, quiet and safe neighbourhood. Museums, a supermarket, a very nice park, and street full of branded shops are nearby. Albertcupstraat market is about 20 minutes walk in the south east. Amsterdam is not a vast city anyway, so we enjoyed walking to places of interest from the hotel. If one prefers the public transport, the tram stop is only a minute walk away.

reviews.text: The room price, too, was above average but acceptable regarding what you receive in return.

reviews.title: A Gem
reviews.text: This was a wonderful small hotel in the heart of the Museum district. Public transportation was nearby making it a perfect location to visit to all of the sites in Amsterdam. Airport transportation was easily available and reliable. The hotel staff was pleasant and very helpful, as I was a solo female traveler. Breakfast, which was included in the room rate offered a great selection of high quality food and certainly the BEST coffee that I had in more than 2 weeks of travel through Europe!! Free internet access was a plus. My room was very small and had poor lighting, however the benefits of this hotel more than compensated for these minor disadvantages. I would highly recommed this hotel and would certainly stay here again.

reviews.title: A Dutch Gem!
reviews.text: The Hotel Aalders was an absolute gem in the heart of Amsterdam. I have been wanting to go to Amsterdam since I was a child, and my husband and I have just returned. I found this hotel on Tripadvisor.com by looking at the other guest reviews. It was way more than we ever expected! The staff was so very helpful, the breakfast so delicous and Eurpoean, the hotel was comfortable and cozy, just what you would want in Europe, and the location was incredible. It is situated between the two most popular musems, one block from a tram stop, and in walking distance from EVERYTHING. It was more than we could have ever hoped for. I travel extensively for my job, and I would be happy to stay here again, anytime. Be sure you ask Mr. Aalders about room 9 when his grandfather hid a Jewish family of 8 in a closet under a stairwell during World War II. Like I said, a Dutch gem.

reviews.title: Solid and relatively inexpensive Amsterdam choice
reviews.text: Having read some of the other reviews on mid-priced Amsterdam hotels - and finding out that both of the exclusively "gay" options had horrible reviews, I selected Hotel Aalders because it was gay-friendly and had pretty good reviews on this site. I was not disappointed.

reviews.title: AMAZING!!
reviews.text: Here's the highlights:

reviews.title: A genuinely friendly hotel.
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are small. If you are visiting Amsterdam and are spending a lot of time in your room, you don't understand the point of travel. The room is small, but it's comfortable for what you need - a place to sleep. I was in Room 1a, which is small but also less expensive. Bed, desk, wardrobe, bathroom, TV, and a window overlooking the back yard. Plus free wifi. That's all I need. There's no A/C, but the window gave a slight breeze and I wasn't uncomfortable (actually a little chilly when I woke up this morning). Yes, the way the shower is set up, you will probably get some water on the floor. Big deal. Make sure you put down the bathmat first.

description: Small, family owned 3-star hotel in southern part of the city centre containing 28 rooms of different sizes and types, with it's own unique character and personal attention towards guests. Certified member of HoReCa Nederland and ANWB Hotel classification guides.
